intro: Conanthera sabulosa, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Conanthera sabulosa plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is considered an important species in desert ecosystems.
